description: A group of inflammatory conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, primarily including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
A biologic therapy used to reduce inflammation by inhibiting tumor necrosis factor α.
A family of enzymes that transduce extracellular signals through the activation of the JAK-STAT signaling pathway.
A family of G protein-coupled receptors that are activated by sphingosine-1-phosphate and play roles in immune responses.
Cytokines that are involved in the immune response and are produced by antigen-presenting cells.
A cytokine that plays a role in regulating immune responses and inflammation.
A pro-inflammatory cytokine involved in the immune response and inflammation.
Enzymes that degrade phosphodiester bonds in nucleotides, important for cellular signaling.
A type of white blood cell that plays a vital role in the immune response by producing antibodies.
A group of immune cells that contribute to the body's immune response, particularly at mucosal barriers.
